empower.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to give someone more control over their own life or situation
empower.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The Voting Rights Act was needed to empower minority groups.
empower.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to give a person or organization the legal right to do something
empower.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The president is empowered to appoint judges to the Supreme Court.
empower.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to give a person or an organization the power or the legal right to do something
empower.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The President is empowered to appoint judges to the Supreme Court.
